candidates.definition: Mechanical systems using toothed wheels to transmit and modify rotational motion, force, and speed.

positive_examples: The car's transmission uses a complex gear system to change speeds.
The bicycle's gear mechanism allows easier pedaling uphill.
The clock's internal gears keep precise time through regulated motion.
The wind turbine's gearbox increases the rotor's slow rotation for electricity generation.
The drill's gear train provides the torque needed for heavy-duty work.
The conveyor system relies on gear assemblies to move products smoothly.
negative_examples: The pulley system uses belts instead of gears to transfer power.
The hydraulic press operates using fluid pressure rather than gears.
The electric motor spins without any gear mechanisms.
The simple lever amplifies force through mechanical advantage alone.
The chain drive connects the bicycle pedals to the rear wheel.
The friction wheel transmits motion through surface contact.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Motors, Engines, Pumps, Levers, Pulleys

candidates.definition: mechanical components that spin, rotate, or enable rotational motion in machines

positive_examples: The motor's rotor spins at 3600 RPM when powered on
The crankshaft transfers power from the pistons to the transmission
A heavy flywheel helps smooth out engine vibrations
The generator's stator windings produce electricity as the rotor turns
The drive shaft connects the engine to the rear wheels
The turbine rotor blades capture wind energy efficiently
negative_examples: The piston moves up and down in the cylinder
The hydraulic pump creates pressure in the system
The belt connects two pulleys together
The gear teeth mesh to change rotational speed
The lever amplifies the applied force
The spring stores mechanical energy when compressed
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Gears, Pistons, Levers, Pumps
